alert.note: Alert for Cuyama Valley; San Luis Obispo County Mountains; Santa Lucia Mountains; Southern Salinas Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 26 at 8:05PM PDT until August 29 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO 8 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures 90 to 98 degrees across inland coastal plain, and 98 to 106 for remaining valleys and lower mountains. Low temperatures expected to range between 65 and 73 degrees, except 75 to 83 degrees across portions of the mountains and foothills. * WHERE...Cuyama Valley, Santa Lucia Mountains, Southern Salinas Valley and San Luis Obispo County Mountains. * WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 8 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Cuyama Valley; San Luis Obispo County Mountains; Santa Lucia Mountains; Southern Salinas Valley
